sen.j: 姉小路（あねこうじ/あねがこうじ/あねのこうじ）とは、御年寄上臈御年寄との違いの名。
sen.e: Anekoji was a different name to the so-called Otoshiyori or Joro-otoshiyori.
Anekoji was another name for so-called Otoshiyori or Joro-otoshiyori.
sen.cmt: 「～の別名」はanother name forの方が自然です。
sen.e: Anekoji was another name for so-called Otoshiyori or Joro-otoshiyori.

sen.j: 大奥では上臈御年寄にこの名が使われることが多かった。
sen.e: In the shogun's harem, this name was often used for Joro-otoshiyori.
In O-oku (the inner halls of Edo Castle where the wife of the Shogun and her servants reside), this name was often used for Joro-otoshiyori.
sen.cmt: 「大奥」をthe shogun's haremと訳してしまうのは乱暴すぎます。
sen.e: In O-oku (the inner halls of Edo Castle where the wife of the Shogun and her servants reside), this name was often used for Joro-otoshiyori.

sen.j: 江戸幕府4代征夷大将軍徳川家綱時代と、11代将軍徳川家斉時代の上臈御年寄が有名である。
sen.e: The Joro-otoshiyori during the 4th generation conquest barbarian general Ietsuna TOKUGAWA and the 11th generation general Ienari TOKUGAWA of the Edo shogunate were famous.

The Joro-otoshiyori during the times of the 4th seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Edo bakufu Ietsuna TOKUGAWA and during the times of the 11th general Ienari TOKUGAWA were famous.
sen.cmt: 4代、11代の訳し方が不自然です。「征夷大将軍」はまずローマ字表記してから英語で内容を説明した方が分かりやすくなります。「時代」の意の訳出も必要です。
sen.e: The Joro-otoshiyori during the times of the 4th seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") of the Edo bakufu Ietsuna TOKUGAWA and during the times of the 11th general Ienari TOKUGAWA were famous.

sen.j: 飛鳥井局とともに御台所となる伏見宮貞清親王の息女顕子女王に随行して江戸へ下った上臈御年寄。
sen.e: The Joro-otoshiyori who accompanied queen Akiko, the daughter of the Imperial Prince Sadakiyo of Fushimi no miya Palace (who became the royal kitchen bureau with ASUKAI no Tsubone), to descend to Edo.
The Joro-otoshiyori who accompanied queen Akiko, a daughter of the Imperial Prince Sadakiyo of Fushimi no miya Palace (who became the royal kitchen bureau with ASUKAI no Tsubone), to descend to Edo.
The Joro-otoshiyori who accompanied queen Akiko, a daughter of the Imperial Prince Sadakiyo of Fushimi no miya Palace (who became the royal kitchen bureau with ASUKAI no Tsubone), to descend to Edo.

tit.j: 家斉・家慶期の姉小路
tit.e: Anekoji during Ienari's period or Ieyoshi's period
Anekoji during Ienari's period or Ieyoshi's period
Anekoji during Ienari's period or Ieyoshi's period

sen.j: 姉小路（あねがこうじ、文化 (元号)7年2月12日 (旧暦)（1810年3月16日） - 明治13年（1880年）8月9日）は、江戸時代末期の大奥の上臈御年寄。
sen.e: Anegakoji (March 16, 1810 to August 9, 1880) was a Joro-otoshiyori in the shogun's harem during the late Edo period.
Anegakoji (March 16, 1810 to August 9, 1880) was a Joro-otoshiyori in O-oku during the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: 「大奥」は原文を生かしてO-okuと表記します。
sen.e: Anegakoji (March 16, 1810 to August 9, 1880) was a Joro-otoshiyori in O-oku during the late Edo period.

sen.j: 名は勝子。
sen.e: Her name was Katsuko.
Her name was Katsuko.
Her name was Katsuko.

sen.j: 大奥ではいよ（伊与子）と称した。
sen.e: In the shogun's harem, she was called Iyo.
In O-oku, she was called Iyo.
sen.cmt: 「大奥」は原文を生かしてO-okuと表記します。
sen.e: In O-oku, she was called Iyo.

sen.j: 父は橋本実誠。
sen.e: Her father was Sanenari HASHIMOTO.
Her father was Sanenari HASHIMOTO.
Her father was Sanenari HASHIMOTO.

sen.j: 兄に橋本実久、妹に水戸藩老女花野井がいる。
sen.e: Her elder brother was Sanehisa HASHIMOTO, and her younger sister was the Mito clan old woman HANANOI.
Her elder brother was Sanehisa HASHIMOTO, and her younger sister was HANANOI, the head of waiting women of the Mito clan.
sen.cmt: 「水戸藩老女」の訳出が不自然です。
sen.e: Her elder brother was Sanehisa HASHIMOTO, and her younger sister was HANANOI, the head of waiting women of the Mito clan.

sen.j: 12代将軍・徳川家慶時代の大奥の権力者の一人となったといわれる。
sen.e: Legends say that she was the one powerful person in the shogun's harem of the 12th generation General Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA period.
She is said to have become one of the most powerful people in O-oku during the times of the 12th general Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処のコメントが漏れています。「大奥」は原文を生かしてO-okuと表記します。「の一人」「12代将軍」の訳出が不自然です。
sen.e: She is said to have become one of the most powerful people in O-oku during the times of the 12th general Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 伝説的な悪行や、政敵への陰謀の画策、更には天保の改革の妨害を試みた、などが伝えられている。
sen.e: It is said that, she attempted legendary evil doings, schemed plots against her rivals, and furthermore, obstructed the reform at Tempo era.
She is also said to have committed legendary misdeeds, schemed plots against her rivals, and furthermore obstructed the Tempo Reforms.
sen.cmt: 悪行を「試みた」だけでなく実際に「行った」と考えられますのでattemptは不適切です。一原文一訳文例外対処のコメントが漏れています。
sen.e: She is also said to have committed legendary misdeeds, schemed plots against her rivals, and furthermore obstructed the Tempo Reforms.

sen.j: 主として稀代の悪女という評価が伝えられる。
sen.e: Briefly speaking, she is criticized as a rare wicked woman of the history.
Briefly speaking, she is criticized as a rare wicked woman of the history.
Briefly speaking, she is criticized as a rare wicked woman of the history.

sen.j: 11代将軍徳川家斉から12代将軍徳川家慶の治世の間、大奥に君臨し、政権運営にも影響力を及ぼして財政の逼迫などの幕府破綻要素を作ったとされている。
sen.e: It is assumed that, during the period between the 11th generation General Ienari TOKUGAWA and the 12th generation General Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA, she reigned over the shogun's harem, extended her influence even to political management, and created factors of tight financial conditions etc which led to the collapse of the shogunate government.

It is assumed that, during the period from the 11th general Ienari TOKUGAWA to the 12th general Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA, she reigned over O-oku, extended her influence even to political management, and made the financial conditions of the bakufu very tight, which is one of the factors that led to the collapse of the shogunate government.
sen.cmt: 「11代将軍」「12代将軍」の表記が不自然です。「大奥」は原文を生かしてO-okuと表記します。「幕府破綻要素を作る」は直訳せず内容を反映した訳にします。
sen.e: It is assumed that, during the period from the 11th general Ienari TOKUGAWA to the 12th general Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA, she reigned over O-oku, extended her influence even to political management, and made the financial conditions of the bakufu very tight, which is one of the factors that led to the collapse of the shogunate government.

sen.j: 和宮親子内親王の大叔母。
sen.e: She was the great-aunt of the imperial princess KAZUNOMIYA Chikako.
She was the great-aunt of the imperial princess KAZUNOMIYA Chikako.
She was the great-aunt of the imperial princess KAZUNOMIYA Chikako.

sen.j: 姉小路は、文化 (元号)元年（1804年）に将軍家継嗣・家慶の御簾中として輿入れした喬子女王付の小上臈として西ノ丸大奥に入った。
sen.e: Anegakoji entered the Nishi no Maru Shogun's Harem as a little Joro attending the lady lord Takako, who was married into the shogunate family as the successor Ieyoshi's legal wife in 1804.
Anegakoji entered the Nishi no Maru O-oku as a little Joro attending the lady lord Takako, who was married into the shogunate family as the successor Ieyoshi's legal wife in 1804.
sen.cmt: 「大奥」は原文を生かしてO-okuと表記します。
sen.e: Anegakoji entered the Nishi no Maru O-oku as a little Joro attending the lady lord Takako, who was married into the shogunate family as the successor Ieyoshi's legal wife in 1804.

sen.j: 家斉の娘・和姫が毛利斉広に輿入れする際に、姉小路は大上臈として和姫に従い毛利家江戸屋敷に入る。
sen.e: When Kazuhime (Ienari 's daughter) was married into Narito MORI, Anegakoji followed Kazuhime and entered the MORI family 's Edo residence.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When Kazuhime (Ienari 's daughter) was married into Narito MORI, Anegakoji followed Kazuhime and entered the Mori family 's residence in Edo.
sen.cmt: 家名は頭文字のみ大文字にします。「江戸にある毛利家屋敷」と訳出します。
sen.e: When Kazuhime (Ienari 's daughter) was married into Narito MORI, Anegakoji followed Kazuhime and entered the Mori family 's residence in Edo.

sen.j: しかし、天保元年（1830年）に和姫が死去したため、再び大奥に戻った。
sen.e: However, when Kazuhime died in 1830, Anegakoji returned to the Shogun's Harem again.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, when Kazuhime died in 1830, Anegakoji returned to O-oku again.
sen.cmt: 「大奥」は原文を生かしてO-okuと表記します。
sen.e: However, when Kazuhime died in 1830, Anegakoji returned to O-oku again.

sen.j: 天保7年（1836年）に上臈御年寄となる。
sen.e: In 1836, Anegakoji became a Joro-otoshiyori.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1836, Anegakoji became a Joro-otoshiyori.
In 1836, Anegakoji became a Joro-otoshiyori.

sen.j: 妹で水戸藩老女花野井とともに美女として有名です。
sen.e: Together with her younger sister who was the Mito clan old woman HANANOI, they were famous as beautiful ladies.
Together with her younger sister HANANOI, the head of waiting women of the Mito clan, she was famous as a beautiful lady.
sen.cmt: 「妹と共に」とあるので、この文の主語は「姉小路は」でなければなりません。
sen.e: Together with her younger sister HANANOI, the head of waiting women of the Mito clan, she was famous as a beautiful lady.

sen.j: 一説によれば家慶と閨を共にしたとも言われている。
sen.e: According to one theory, it is even said that she went to bed with Ieyoshi together.
According to one theory, it is even said that she went to bed with Ieyoshi together.
According to one theory, it is even said that she went to bed with Ieyoshi together.

sen.j: 幕末期の大奥が水戸徳川家を嫌い始めたのは姉小路が嫌い始めたためではないかといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that the shogun's harem of the late shogunate period began to dislike Mito Tokugawa family because Anegakoji began to dislike them.
It is said that O-oku began to dislike the Mito Tokugawa family in the late shogunate period because Anegakoji began to dislike them.
sen.cmt: 「大奥」は原文を生かしてO-okuと表記します。
sen.e: It is said that O-oku began to dislike the Mito Tokugawa family in the late shogunate period because Anegakoji began to dislike them.

sen.j: それは大奥の経費が高すぎると斉昭が批判したためと言われている。
sen.e: The reason is said to be the criticism by Nariaki that the expenditures of the shogun's harem were too expensive.
The reason for such dislike is said to be the criticism by Nariaki that the expenditures of O-oku were too large.
sen.cmt: 何のreasonなのかを明らかにします。「大奥」は原文を生かしてO-okuと表記します。Expenditureが多額であることを表すにはlargeを用います。
sen.e: The reason for such dislike is said to be the criticism by Nariaki that the expenditures of O-oku were too large.

sen.j: しかしながら、姉小路は一橋派の諸大名と親しく、水戸家とも連携を取っていたことも留意される。
sen.e: However, Anegakoji was on intimate terms with the various feudal lords of the Hitotsubashi faction, and she was also noted to be cooperating with the Mito family.
However, it should be noted that Anegakoji was on intimate terms with the various feudal lords of the Hitotsubashi faction and was cooperating with the Mito family.
sen.cmt: be noted to不定詞という構文は不可。
sen.e: However, it should be noted that Anegakoji was on intimate terms with the various feudal lords of the Hitotsubashi faction and was cooperating with the Mito family.

sen.j: これは斉昭が謹慎処分となった折にも影響した。
sen.e: This might as well bear influence on the time when Nariaki became warned on penitence.
This may have had an influence when Nairaki was placed on probation.
sen.cmt: 「謹慎処分となった」の訳出が不自然です。
sen.e: This may have had an influence when Nairaki was placed on probation.

sen.j: 当時、斉昭は奥女中三保野と通じて大奥工作をし、その処分の許しを請おうと図った。
sen.e: At that time, Nariaki attempted to beg for forgiveness to the penalty via the maid Mihono who worked with the shogun's harem.
At that time, Nariaki attempted to beg for forgiveness of the probation via the maid Mihono who worked in O-oku.
sen.cmt: 「大奥」は原文を生かしてO-okuと表記します。
sen.e: At that time, Nariaki attempted to beg for forgiveness of the probation via the maid Mihono who worked in O-oku.

sen.j: しかし、姉小路がこれを聞きとがめて三保野は暇を出されてしまったという。
sen.e: But Anegakoji heard this, blamed and laid off Mihono.
However, hearing of his attempt, Anegakoji laid off Mihono.
sen.cmt: 「聞きとがめる」は「耳にする」ぐらいの意です。
sen.e: However, hearing of his attempt, Anegakoji laid off Mihono.

sen.j: 天保12年（1842年）に姉小路が食していた天ぷらが原因で火事を起こし、本丸を全焼させてしまう。
sen.e: In 1842, a fire was caused by the tempura that Anegakoji ate, and the castle proper was burnt down.
In 1842, a fire was caused due to the tempura that Anegakoji was eating, and Honmaru (the keep of a castle) was burnt down.
In 1842, a fire was caused due to the tempura that Anegakoji was eating, and Honmaru (the keep of a castle) was burnt down.

sen.j: この火事で奥女中が数百人死亡するという大惨事となった。
sen.e: This fire became a large disaster that hundreds of maids working in shogun's harem died.
This fire led to a large disaster in which hundreds of maids working in O-oku died.
sen.cmt: 「大奥」は原文を生かしてO-okuと表記します。
sen.e: This fire led to a large disaster in which hundreds of maids working in O-oku died.

sen.j: 姉小路は広大院付の上臈御年寄・梅渓に罪をなすり付けた。
sen.e: Anegakoji accused the Joro-otoshiyori named UMETANI who served Kodaiin of the guilt.
Anegakoji laid the blame on the Joro-otoshiyori named UMETANI who served Kodaiin.
sen.cmt: 「罪をなすりつける」の訳出が不自然です。
sen.e: Anegakoji laid the blame on the Joro-otoshiyori named UMETANI who served Kodaiin.

sen.j: 梅渓のその後は知られていない。
sen.e: As for what happened to Baikei afterward is not known.
No one knows what happened to UMETANI after that.
sen.cmt: isの主語が存在せず、文が成り立ちません。
sen.e: No one knows what happened to UMETANI after that.

sen.j: 家慶の死去後に落飾、勝光院と号して上臈御年寄を引退。
sen.e: After Ieyoshi died, she got her head shaved, took up the title Shokoin and retired from being a Joro-otoshiyori.
After Ieyoshi died, she got her head shaved, took up the title Shokoin and retired from being a Joro-otoshiyori.
After Ieyoshi died, she got her head shaved, took up the title Shokoin and retired from being a Joro-otoshiyori.

sen.j: 大奥から毛利家江戸屋敷に居を移した。
sen.e: She moved out from shogun's harem to the MORI family's Edo residence.
She moved out from O-oku to the Mori family's residence in Edo.
sen.cmt: 「大奥」は原文を生かしてO-okuと表記します。
sen.e: She moved out from O-oku to the Mori family's residence in Edo.

sen.j: 引退したとはいえ、政治的発言力は保っていた。
sen.e: Although she retired, her political influence was still there.
Although she retired, her political influence was still there.
Although she retired, her political influence was still there.

sen.j: 兄・実久の孫娘・和宮を公武合体の一貫として14代将軍・徳川家茂の御台所に迎える政策で、姉小路は和宮の降嫁を橋本家や姪の橋本経子（和宮の母）に何度も要求したという。
sen.e: It is said that, during the marriage strategy of receiving the granddaughter Kazunomiya of her elder brother Sanehisa into the royal kitchen of the 14 generation General Iemochi TOKUGAWA as part of the consistent Kobugattai (combining noble and general) process, Anegakoji requested many times to the HASHIMOTO family and her niece Keiko HASHIMOTO (Kazunomiya's mother) about the rank-down marriage of Kazunomiya.

In connection with the policy of receiving Kazunomiya, a granddauthter of her elder brother Sanehisa, into the royal kitchen of the 14th general Iemochi TOKUGAWA as part of the Kobugattai (combining noble and general) process, Anegakoji is said to have asked many times the Hashimoto family and her niece Keiko HASHIMOTO (Kazunomiya's mother) for the rank-down marriage of Kazunomiya.
sen.cmt: 「兄・実久の孫娘」「14代将軍」「迎える政策で」の訳出が不自然です。またrequest ～ to …aboutという形は一般的ではありません。
sen.e: In connection with the policy of receiving Kazunomiya, a granddauthter of her elder brother Sanehisa, into the royal kitchen of the 14th general Iemochi TOKUGAWA as part of the Kobugattai (combining noble and general) process, Anegakoji is said to have asked many times the Hashimoto family and her niece Keiko HASHIMOTO (Kazunomiya's mother) for the rank-down marriage of Kazunomiya.

sen.j: 姉小路自ら京都に赴き、降嫁を要求した事もあった。
sen.e: There was even an occasion when Anegakoji went all the way to Kyoto in order to request for the rank-down marriage.
There was even an occasion when Anegakoji went all the way to Kyoto in order to request for the rank-down marriage.
There was even an occasion when Anegakoji went all the way to Kyoto in order to request for the rank-down marriage.

sen.j: 江戸幕府崩壊後は京都の実家に戻った。
sen.e: She returned to her home town in Kyoto after the Edo shogunate had collapsed.
She returned to her home town in Kyoto after the Edo shogunate had collapsed.
She returned to her home town in Kyoto after the Edo shogunate had collapsed.

sen.j: 明治13年（1880年）に70歳で死去したという。
sen.e: It is said that she died in 1880 at the age of 70.
It is said that she died in 1880 at the age of 70.
It is said that she died in 1880 at the age of 70.
